Utility Functions

Source: R/calculations.R
calculations.Rd

Common utility functions

Returns a tibble of summary stats

Usage

change(df, cols, digits = 3)

years_df(df, date_col)

years_vec(date_col)

duration_vec(date_col)

summary_stats(
  df,
  condition = NULL,
  group_vars = NULL,
  summary_vars = NULL,
  arr = NULL,
  digits = 3
)

Arguments

df

data frame

cols

numeric columns

digits

Number of digits to round to, default is 3

date_col

date column

condition

filter condition, i.e. patient == "new"

group_vars

variables to group by, i.e. c(specialty, state, hcpcs, cost)

summary_vars

variables to summarise, i.e. c(min, max, mode, range)

arr

column to arrange data by, i.e. cost

Value

tibble() or vector

Examples

## Lagged Calculations

ex <- dplyr::tibble(
              year = rep(2020:2021, each = 4),
              grp = rep(c("a", "b"), 4),
              pay = sample(1000:2000, 8))
ex
#> # A tibble: 8 × 3
#>    year grp     pay
#>   <int> <chr> <int>
#> 1  2020 a      1458
#> 2  2020 b      1540
#> 3  2020 a      1027
#> 4  2020 b      1221
#> 5  2021 a      1819
#> 6  2021 b      1961
#> 7  2021 a      1908
#> 8  2021 b      1211

# `change()` # Change, percentage change, and cumulative sum

dplyr::filter(ex, grp == "a") |>
change(c(pay))
#> # A tibble: 4 × 7
#>    year grp     pay pay_chg pay_chg_cum pay_pct pay_pct_cum
#>   <int> <chr> <int>   <int>       <int>   <dbl>       <dbl>
#> 1  2020 a      1458       0           0   0           0    
#> 2  2020 a      1027    -431        -431  -0.296      -0.296
#> 3  2021 a      1819     792         361   0.771       0.475
#> 4  2021 a      1908      89         450   0.049       0.524

# When performing a `group_by()`, watch for
# the correct order of the variables

dplyr::arrange(ex, year) |>
dplyr::group_by(grp) |>
change(c(pay))
#> # A tibble: 8 × 7
#> # Groups:   grp [2]
#>    year grp     pay pay_chg pay_chg_cum pay_pct pay_pct_cum
#>   <int> <chr> <int>   <int>       <int>   <dbl>       <dbl>
#> 1  2020 a      1458       0           0   0          0     
#> 2  2020 b      1540       0           0   0          0     
#> 3  2020 a      1027    -431        -431  -0.296     -0.296 
#> 4  2020 b      1221    -319        -319  -0.207     -0.207 
#> 5  2021 a      1819     792         361   0.771      0.475 
#> 6  2021 b      1961     740         421   0.606      0.399 
#> 7  2021 a      1908      89         450   0.049      0.524 
#> 8  2021 b      1211    -750        -329  -0.382      0.0170

# `chg()` # Change over a vector

dplyr::filter(ex, grp == "a") |>
dplyr::mutate(change = chg(pay))
#> # A tibble: 4 × 4
#>    year grp     pay change
#>   <int> <chr> <int>  <int>
#> 1  2020 a      1458      0
#> 2  2020 a      1027   -431
#> 3  2021 a      1819    792
#> 4  2021 a      1908     89

# `pct()` # Percentage change over a vector

dplyr::filter(ex, grp == "a") |>
dplyr::mutate(pct_change = pct(pay))
#> # A tibble: 4 × 4
#>    year grp     pay pct_change
#>   <int> <chr> <int>      <dbl>
#> 1  2020 a      1458     0     
#> 2  2020 a      1027    -0.296 
#> 3  2021 a      1819     0.771 
#> 4  2021 a      1908     0.0489

# `ror()` # Rate of return

dplyr::filter(ex, grp == "a") |>
ror(pay)
#> # A tibble: 4 × 4
#>    year grp     pay pay_ror
#>   <int> <chr> <int>   <dbl>
#> 1  2020 a      1458  NA    
#> 2  2020 a      1027   0.704
#> 3  2021 a      1819   1.77 
#> 4  2021 a      1908   1.05 

# `geomean()` # Geometric mean

dplyr::filter(ex, grp == "a") |>
ror(pay) |>
dplyr::summarise(gmean = geomean(pay_ror))
#> # A tibble: 1 × 1
#>   gmean
#>   <dbl>
#> 1  1.09

# `change_year()` # Lagged change by column

dplyr::filter(ex, grp == "a") |>
change_year(pay, year)
#> # A tibble: 4 × 5
#>    year grp     pay pay_chg pay_pct
#>   <int> <chr> <int>   <int>   <dbl>
#> 1  2020 a      1458      NA  NA    
#> 2  2020 a      1027    -431  -0.296
#> 3  2021 a      1819     792   0.771
#> 4  2021 a      1908      89   0.049


## Calculating Timespans
dt <- dplyr::tibble(date = lubridate::today() - 366)
dt
#> # A tibble: 1 × 1
#>   date      
#>   <date>    
#> 1 2022-10-17

# `years_df()`/`years_vec()` # Years passed

years_df(dt, date)
#> # A tibble: 1 × 2
#>   date       years_passed
#>   <date>            <dbl>
#> 1 2022-10-17            1

dplyr::mutate(dt, years = years_vec(date))
#> # A tibble: 1 × 2
#>   date       years
#>   <date>     <dbl>
#> 1 2022-10-17     1

# `duration_vec()` # Duration since date

dplyr::mutate(dt, dur = duration_vec(date))
#> # A tibble: 1 × 2
#>   date       dur                   
#>   <date>     <Duration>            
#> 1 2022-10-17 -31622400s (~-1 years)


## Summary Statistics
sm <- dplyr::tibble(provider = sample(c("A", "B", "C"), size = 200, replace = TRUE),
                    city = sample(c("ATL", "NYC"), size = 200, replace = TRUE),
                    charges = sample(1000:2000, size = 200),
                    payment = sample(1000:2000, size = 200))

head(sm)
#> # A tibble: 6 × 4
#>   provider city  charges payment
#>   <chr>    <chr>   <int>   <int>
#> 1 A        NYC      1539    1490
#> 2 B        ATL      1503    1272
#> 3 C        ATL      1382    1564
#> 4 B        ATL      1985    1314
#> 5 B        ATL      1627    1794
#> 6 A        ATL      1088    1881

summary_stats(sm,
              condition = city == "ATL",
              group_vars = provider,
              summary_vars = c(charges, payment),
              arr = provider)
#> # A tibble: 3 × 8
#>   provider charges_median charges_mean charges_sd payment_median payment_mean
#>   <chr>             <dbl>        <dbl>      <dbl>          <dbl>        <dbl>
#> 1 C                 1492.        1520.       280.           1458        1441.
#> 2 B                 1500         1501.       278.           1581        1499.
#> 3 A                 1407         1482.       296.           1606        1523.
#> # ℹ 2 more variables: payment_sd <dbl>, n <int>
